TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder
Class SegmentConstruct

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder.SegmentConstruct

public class SegmentConstruct
extends java.lang.Object

This class verifies and prepares the parameters in order to encode one or several segments.
Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run

Version:
1.2
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

setBlocksPerSegment

public static int[][] setBlocksPerSegment(int[] blocksPerSegment,
                                          int[] WTLevels,
                                          int xSize,
                                          int ySize,
                                          int zSize)
Set the parameter BlocksPerSegment. This parameters should be the first to be set.

Parameters:
blocksPerSegment - definition in SegmentCode2D.blocksPerSegment
WTLevels - definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTLevels
xSize - integer containing the width of each original component
ySize - integer containing the height of each original component
zSize - integer containing the height of each original component
Returns:
an integer array containing the number of blocks employed to encode each segment for each channel.

getBlocksPerChannel

public static int getBlocksPerChannel(int squaredBlockSize,
                                      int xSize,
                                      int ySize)
Determines the number of blocks contained in a given channel.

Parameters:
squaredBlockSize - integer that indicates the horizontal (vertical) size of a block.
xSize - integer containing the width of the channel
ySize - integer containing the height of the channel
Returns:
an integer containing the number of blocks in a segment with such dimensions

yOriginalSize - definition in yOriginalSize

run

public int[][][] run()
              throws ParameterException
Performs the bit plane encoding and writes the encoded image to the disk

Returns:
an array of integers which determines which blocks belong to each segment; blockInSegment[channel][segment][block]
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and the construction of the segment must be stopped
ParameterException
